page.title: 06Four Oaks Local History
page.content: Remains of a Roman Road can be seen in Sutton Park and a road in an exclusive housing area is named Roman Road. The region is closely associated with the general history of Sutton Coldfield, which was part of the Kingdom of Mercia and was mentioned in the Domesday Book of 1086. The area was inhabited by the charcoal burners of earlier times. The town was granted a charter of incorporation by Henry Vlll in 1528,mostly at the instigation of Bishop Vesey. A new charter was granted by Charles ll in 1664. In 1871 a railway was built from Sutton to Walsall. This ran through Sutton Park,much to the anger of local residents.The line was axed in the 1960's. Much urban development has taken place especially since 1960 and this has increased since incorporation with Birmingham in 1974.
